text.p: Following is a summary of major political and business stories in local newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Shanghai. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy.
- SHANGHAI SECURITIES NEWS - China's economic tsar Zhu Rongji called for further measures to control risk on the financial markets.
- Listed companies account for seven of the 10 largest retailers in China.
- Only 38 of 530 listed firms have issued their 1996 annual results with half of the reporting season having passed and a deadline of April 30 drawing near.
- President Tong Zengyin of China's sole private bank, Minsheng Bank, calls for withdrawal of small coins from circulation.
- BUSINESS NEWS - Actual foreign investment in China is expected to hit $49.5 billion in 1997, an increase of 15 percent against 1996.
- The central government will start a serious investigation into the dumping of foreign goods in China.
- A recent survey finds that all major Shanghai electrical products squeezed out of top four sales rankings for televisions, refrigerators and washing machines.
